title: Provides for a special-use permit for ambulatory veterinarians to use oversized or commercial vehicles on the Taconic state parkway
summary: Provides for a special-use permit for oversized or commercial vehicles on the Taconic state parkway; includes ambulatory veterinarians.

       Introduced by M. of A. CAHILL -- read once and referred to the Committee
         on Transportation

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the  transportation  law,  in  relation to providing
         special-use permits for certain commercial or  oversized  vehicles  on
         certain special parkways

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 5 of section 71 of the transportation  law,  as
    2  added  by chapter 370 of the laws of 1979, is amended and a new subdivi-
    3  sion 8 is added to read as follows:
    4    5. To limit or prohibit travel by types or classes of commercial vehi-
    5  cles as may be required due to roadway design or  safety  considerations
    6  EXCEPT  AS  PROVIDED IN SUBDIVISION EIGHT OF THIS SECTION, and to estab-
    7  lish speed limits and standards of travel safety  on  all  such  special
    8  parkways designated by this article.
    9    8. NOTWITHSTANDING ANY LAW, RULES, OR REGULATIONS TO THE CONTRARY, THE
   10  COMMISSIONER  SHALL PROMULGATE RULES AND REGULATIONS NECESSARY TO IMPLE-
   11  MENT A SPECIAL-USE PERMIT FOR CERTAIN COMMERCIAL OR  OVERSIZED  VEHICLES
   12  PERMITTING THE USE OF CERTAIN SPECIAL PARKWAYS INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMIT-
   13  ED TO, AMBULATORY VETERINARIANS USE OF THE TACONIC STATE PARKWAY.
   14    (A)  THE  OWNER  OF SUCH COMMERCIAL OR OVERSIZED VEHICLE MAY FILE WITH
   15  THE COMMISSIONER OR ANY AGENT OF THE  COMMISSIONER  AN  APPLICATION  FOR
   16  ISSUANCE  OF  SPECIAL-USE PERMIT FOR SUCH VEHICLE. THE APPLICATION SHALL
   17  BE MADE ON A FORM FURNISHED BY THE COMMISSIONER  FOR  SUCH  PURPOSE  AND
   18  SHALL  CONTAIN  SUCH  INFORMATION  AS THE COMMISSIONER SHALL REQUIRE. IF
   19  SATISFIED THAT THE VEHICLE  IS  TO  BE  OPERATED  AS  PROVIDED  IN  THIS
   20  SECTION,  THE  COMMISSIONER  SHALL  UPON PAYMENT OF A FEE OF TEN DOLLARS
   21  ASSIGN TO SUCH VEHICLE A DISTINCTIVE NUMBER AND ISSUE AND DELIVER TO THE
   22  APPLICANT A SPECIAL-USE PERMIT, IN SUCH FORM AS THE  COMMISSIONER  SHALL
   23  PRESCRIBE,  INDICATING WHERE TO DISPLAY SUCH PERMIT IN SUCH VEHICLE, THE

    4    (B)  IF  A  SPECIAL-USE  PERMIT IS ISSUED BY A COUNTY CLERK, ACTING AS
    5  AGENT OF THE COMMISSIONER, SUCH COUNTY CLERK SHALL BE  ENTITLED  TO  THE
    6  SUM  OF  THIRTY-FIVE CENTS FOR EACH SPECIAL-USE PERMIT ISSUED, WHICH SUM
    7  SHALL BE DEDUCTED BEFORE REMITTING THE FEE FOR SUCH  SPECIAL-USE  PERMIT
    8  TO THE COMMISSIONER.
    9    S 2. This act shall take effect on the one hundred twentieth day after

   12  necessary for the implementation of this act on its effective  date  are
   13  authorized  and  directed  to  be  made  and completed on or before such
   14  effective date.
